questions.question: How does Auth0 help prevent phishing through its Universal Login feature?
choices: By centralizing authentication with branded, consistent login pages
By encrypting passwords with custom algorithms
By generating a new username for every session
By disabling OAuth flows temporarily

questions.question: What security feature does Okta provide to detect potential phishing during logins?
choices: User Behavior Analytics to flag anomalous login patterns
Automatic password resets every login
Disabling email as a login identifier
Embedding reCAPTCHA on logout

questions.question: In OAuth 2.0, how can phishing be mitigated during the authorization process?
choices: By using Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) to bind authorization codes to the client
By encrypting the user's password in the authorization request
By issuing longer-lived tokens by default
By requiring users to type their password twice

questions.question: What is a common phishing risk associated with SAML-based Single Sign-On?
choices: Users can be tricked into visiting fake IdP login pages
SAML tokens cannot be encrypted
It requires passwords to be stored locally
It bypasses MFA entirely

questions.question: How can an identity provider like Okta help prevent phishing at login?
choices: By enforcing custom domains for login to prevent domain spoofing
By randomizing login page designs
By allowing any third-party to manage MFA policies
By shortening session timeouts to 1 minute

questions.question: How does WebAuthn help prevent phishing in identity platforms like Auth0 or Okta?
choices: It binds authentication to the origin, preventing credential interception on fake sites
It encrypts passwords using asymmetric encryption
It forces users to change devices for every login
It disables MFA for known devices

questions.question: What Okta feature helps detect phishing through session anomalies?
choices: Risk-based Authentication policies
Randomized login forms
Daily forced password changes
Multiple simultaneous MFA prompts

questions.question: How can OAuth redirect URIs be abused in phishing attacks?
choices: If improperly validated, users can be redirected to malicious sites post-authentication
They encrypt passwords locally before submission
They enforce device fingerprinting
They disable user prompts during token issuance

questions.question: How does using custom domains in Auth0 enhance phishing protection?
choices: It ensures users always authenticate via familiar, branded URLs
It hides the login form in an iframe
It forces logout on multiple devices
It enables passwordless by default

questions.question: Why is enforcing MFA critical in preventing phishing on identity platforms like Okta and Auth0?
choices: It blocks account access even if credentials are phished
It encrypts user credentials before phishing attempts
It anonymizes user email addresses
It increases session length for convenience

questions.question: Which of these is a common trait of a spear phishing attempt?
choices: It’s sent to thousands of users at once
It only targets your spam folder
It references something specific you did recently
It contains lots of emojis

questions.question: You're building a login page. What design choice can help users detect phishing?
choices: Minimize text and use emojis
Randomize button placements for security
Use clear domain branding and avoid redirects
Add animations and sound effects

questions.question: A phishing site perfectly mimics a bank’s login page. What’s a key way to identify it’s fake?
choices: It uses dark mode by default
The login form is too simple
The URL doesn't match the real domain
It doesn't have a background image

questions.question: You receive an email saying 'Your account was compromised, click here to reset your password.' What's the most important thing to check first?
choices: How urgent the message sounds
If your name is capitalized
The sender's address and the URL link
Whether the email has a logo

questions.question: You're building a login page. What design choice can help users detect phishing?
choices: Minimize text and use emojis
Add animations and sound effects
Randomize button placements for security
Use clear domain branding and avoid redirects

questions.question: A phishing site tricks a user into logging in. What can the attacker now do?
choices: Back up the user’s cloud photos
Automatically upgrade the user's plan
Use the stolen credentials to impersonate the user
Improve their SEO ranking

questions.question: Which of these is a common trait of a spear phishing attempt?
choices: It only targets your spam folder
It contains lots of emojis
It references something specific you did recently
It’s sent to thousands of users at once

questions.question: Why might phishing emails intentionally include typos or poor grammar?
choices: Because English is banned in some regions
To avoid triggering spam filters
To appear more relatable
To filter out more tech-savvy users

questions.question: Which statement about HTTPS is true when it comes to phishing?
choices: A phishing site can still have a valid HTTPS certificate
HTTPS guarantees the site is legitimate
HTTPS is only used by banks and e-commerce
If it’s HTTPS, phishing is impossible

questions.question: Why is multi-factor authentication a strong defense against phishing?
choices: It encrypts the entire email thread
It hides your email address from attackers
It blocks phishing emails from loading images
It requires an attacker to steal something beyond just your password

questions.question: What is one reason attackers often use shortened URLs in phishing emails?
choices: To improve deliverability in spam filters
To avoid using images
To hide the actual destination domain
To allow multiple links in one message

questions.question: Your coworker received an email asking for gift cards 'as a surprise for the CEO.' What should they do?
choices: Buy the gift cards and expense it
Forward it to the CEO to ask
Report it as phishing to the security team
Reply asking which kind of gift cards
